title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 211.6 - Motion to withdraw or modify
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 211.6 - Motion to withdraw or modify

State Regulations
(a) Any person, entity, or party served with a subpoena may file a motion with the
administrative law judge on notice to all parties, to withdraw or modify any
subpoena issued pursuant to this Part. (b) Any such motion must be made as soon as
reasonably possible after the service of the subpoena so as not to interfere
with the processing of the case. (c) The administrative law judge upon motion
or
sua sponte
may withdraw or modify a subpoena issued
pursuant to this Part for good cause. (d) Nothing in this section shall in any way
affect any rights of any person or entity under law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4
ยง
211.6

Amended

New

York State Register August 2, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 31, eff. 8/2/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
